NSCAD Admission is ongoing for all interested candidate who wishes to apply for the ongoing admission: the admission requirements is listed below: 

 

NSCAD Admission Requirements and Application Processes

English Language Proficiency Requirement

All applicants whose language of learning either in high school (for at least three years) or at the post-secondary level (for at least one year) is not in English must forward the evidence of their ability to carry on studies in English. This evidence must be provided through one of the following:

 ENGLISH LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY REQUIREMENTS
 TEST   UNDERGRADUATE  GRADUATE
 TOEFL [code: 3265]  at a minimum  score of 90 with no assessment less than 20  at least 94 with no test less than 22
 IELTS  at a minimum score of  6.5 with no band less than 6.0  at least a slightest score of 7.0 with no band less than 6.0
 CAEL  at least 69 with no band less than 60  at least 69 with no band less than 60
 CanTest  at least 4.5 with no part less than 4.0  at least 4.5 with no amount less than 4.0
 CAE  at  least a minimum grade of  B  at least A
 MELAB  at least 82 with no band less than 80  at least 82 with no band less than 80
 IB  at least 5 in English A1 or A2 HL  at least 5 in English A1 or A2 HL
 AP

[code: 5773]

 

  at least 4 in English Language and Composition or Literature and Arrangement  at least 4 in English Language and Composition or Literature and Composition

Language School Undergraduate Degree Pathway Programs

Those who successfully complete the following programs will be granted full admission to NSCAD undergraduate and post-baccalaureate certificate programs without submitting results from one of the above-listed tests.

  • These test results have to be sent directly from the testing service to NSCAD University Admissions Office to be considered effective. Apex Language and Career College (ALCC) University Bridging Program
  • Canadian Language Learning College (CLLC) University Pathway Program
  • East Coast Language College (ECLC) University College Pathway
  • Halifax Language Institute of Canada (HLIC) University Bridging Program
  • International Centre for English for Academic Purposes (ICEAP) English Academic Tuition Program
  • International Language Institute (ILI) University Pathway Program
  • Language Studies International (LSI) Advanced (Level 5)
  • The Language Centre at Saint Mary’s University English for Academic Determinations

How to apply for NASCAD:

Application Procedure

TO APPLY:

  • join NSCAD.CA
  • apply online
  • Admission Essay
  • submit transcripts
  • letters of Recommendation
  • portfolio
  • application fee

make a payment of $70. Pay online at my. nscad.ca

Note that: all payments made are non-refundable.
